channel.title: New Veyron SuperSport breaks 267MPH
channel.description:
Just watching Top Gear, Top Gear were there when James may first hit 258MPH, then a Volkswagen test driver manages to get 267MPH. Oh, and it is the fastest car to ever go round the Top Gear test track.
Lets discuss this incredible car.

item.title: New Veyron SuperSport breaks 267MPH
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

No doubt Volkswagen has one. Probably more then one.

Do you even know the basics of cost calculating?

Read full topic

item.title: New Veyron SuperSport breaks 267MPH
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:112, topic:351129”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=447488.msg3519920#msg3519920 date=1299338764]
So in other words, they calculate the costs properly? lol.
[/quote]

Yep. The reason most ordinary cars are much more cheaper is because they are mass produced. That way, the research costs per car are very low. There are only 250 Veyron’s, and like I said the engine is something entirely new. And you have to do a lot of testing before you can sell a car that goes 269.80 mph. You need a windtunnel for that, and they don’t come cheap either. Again, these costs have to be spread over only a few cars.[/quote]
You say ‘You need a windtunnel’ like car manufacturers don’t already have one of their own…

Read full topic

item.title: New Veyron SuperSport breaks 267MPH
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Mopman:

So in other words, they calculate the costs properly? lol.

Yep. The reason most ordinary cars are much more cheaper is because they are mass produced. That way, the research costs per car are very low. There are only 250 Veyron’s, and like I said the engine is something entirely new. And you have to do a lot of testing before you can sell a car that goes 269.80 mph. You need a windtunnel for that, and they don’t come cheap either. Again, these costs have to be spread over only a few cars.

Read full topic

item.title: New Veyron SuperSport breaks 267MPH
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Moparisthebest:

That is just a load of bullshit, and anyone who believes it is an idiot. The way they get by spewing such bullshit is because they take into account all vehicle research done over the last X years, construction of factories, probably even training of workers and health benefits and stuff. There is absolutely no way in hell that this car, or any car for that matter, has greater than $2,000,000 worth of parts in it.

So in other words, they calculate the costs properly? lol.

Read full topic

item.title: New Veyron SuperSport breaks 267MPH
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Take in to account everything you want. You can’t deny that the Veyron is the greatest super car ever made to date, maybe even the best car. Goes in the top 3 wth Mclaren F1 and a Caterham 7

Read full topic

item.title: New Veyron SuperSport breaks 267MPH
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

The car costs more to manufacture than you have to pay for it.

That is just a load of bullshit, and anyone who believes it is an idiot. The way they get by spewing such bullshit is because they take into account all vehicle research done over the last X years, construction of factories, probably even training of workers and health benefits and stuff. There is absolutely no way in hell that this car, or any car for that matter, has greater than $2,000,000 worth of parts in it.

@many of your points. So who says it is better to spend countless millions of dollars developing a car that with a high-tech lightweight motor and frame when you can spend many times less using existing parts to meet the same purpose? A standard Chevrolet 502 V8 can put out 1200HP and the same torque with a single 4 barrel carb and natural aspiration, rather easily. You can get one cast in aluminum or even magnesium for high-end cars, and we are still talking millions less than this car. So again, I’d like anyone to explain how this Veyron could possibly be considered so ‘incredible’ for the price tag they want for it.

Read full topic

item.title: New Veyron SuperSport breaks 267MPH
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

The car costs more to manufacture than you have to pay for it. Sure, you can build a faster car in your garage, but you don’t have to test it’s safety, test it’s aerodynamics in windtunnels etc. You just put a powerful engine into a lightweight car. What Volkswagen did was make a new engine design, a W configuration, add four turbochargers, put it into a car body that is aerodynamically (and visually) close to complete awesomeness, add parts that change when accelerating to increase grip and speed, make an interior that is comfortable and luxurious, and out came the Veyron.

Sure, your American muscle car might have a more powerful engine, but because they are the shape of concrete blocks they need more power just to keep up with the Veyron. And they’re not even production cars. Who knows what the Veyron is capable of doing when a tuner has laid it’s hands on it.

Read full topic

item.title: New Veyron SuperSport breaks 267MPH
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

So it’s luxurious on the inside? Damn right, it should be for $2 million dollars. So you can build a car this fast for $100,000, and don’t think that for less than the balance of $1,900,000 you could have someone custom build you any interior made out of any material in the world for that? You could probably have it made out of the skins of humans for less than that price.

Read full topic

item.title: New Veyron SuperSport breaks 267MPH
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Besides, the Veyron is more that just a stunningly fast car. It’s luxurious on the inside, and I bet that you could tour the whole of Europe with it without ever feeling sore. Unlike other fast cars, like a Gumpert.

Read full topic

item.title: New Veyron SuperSport breaks 267MPH
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:101, topic:351129”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=447488.msg3472067#msg3472067 date=1295372867]

Basically, cars must drive a specific 1000+ mile route to race 5 times at 4 different drag strips over a week, with no support trailer, proving they are in fact streetable cars.

[/quote]
err what? just because a car doesnt need a support trailer doesnt mean its street legal, it has to adhere to a bunch of rules and regulations, which knowing your country, probably only limit things like a turbine in the car. Over here at least there are a bunch of standards that the car has to meet, if the car doesnt meet those its not road legal regardless of whether it needs a support trailer[/quote]

There are limitations and regulations, obviously these cars have to be street-legal to drive on the roads as well.

Read full topic

Over here at least there are a bunch of standards that the car has to meet, if the car doesnt meet those its not road legal regardless of whether it needs a support trailer

Jay Leno is allowed to ride his turbine engine motorcycle on public roads, so I doubt there are any limitations at all.

item.title: New Veyron SuperSport breaks 267MPH
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Mr Mopar X:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=849FEfK7-V4

That might be the fastest street car in England, but certainly not in the world, look at this awesome event:

Hot Rod Network – 1 Jan 11

Hot Rod Drag Week 2010 Official Coverage - Hot Rod Magazine

Check out our official coverage of Hot Rod Drag Week 2010 presented by Gear Vendors. We have it all from the Por-street class, to the Modified class, to Street Race, and more! Only at www.hotrod.com, the official website for Hot Rod Magazine.

Basically, cars must drive a specific 1000+ mile route to race 5 times at 4 different drag strips over a week, with no support trailer, proving they are in fact streetable cars.

You can look at the final results here:

Hot Rod Network – 19 Sep 10

Final Coverage and Results - Hot Rod Magazine

Official Final Results and Coverage From the 2010 Drag Week. Only at www.hotrod.com, the official website for the 2010 Hot Rod Drag Week.

The top car (a 1966 Chevy II) ran an average ET over 5 races of 7.0725, but his fastest run was a 6.9560 @209.1MPH. Now THAT is a fucking fast street car.

Read full topic
